subject: College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Texas A&M officials admonished Coach Dennis Franchione for his for-pay newsletter. Franchione did not lose his job, but the athletic director, Bill Byrne, said the newsletter — which delivered inside information to boosters for $1,200 a year — would be considered when he evaluates the coach after the season. The university said it would report the results of an internal investigation to the N.C.A.A. because of possible violations.Franchione was also ordered to shut down his Web site, CoachFran.com. A&M reported that the Web site and e-mails generated about $80,000 between 2005 and 2007. The school said Franchione’s net profit was $37,806.32.
